_header: God that all this world has wrought
_description: A carol to Christ against dangers and temptations — four quatrains and burden: ‘Now jhesus rector anime / Ne cademus sustine’

CamStJohn259.First Lines:
God þat all þis word has wroȝthAnd with precius blod
                    hath both…
CamStJohn259.Last Lines:
…mete drynk & cloth we haue no morepro nostro graciam
                    opere
CamStJohn259.Editions:
James,  Montague Rhodes,  and  G. C. Macaulay, eds.  
             “Fifteenth Century Carols and Other Pieces.” 
             Modern Language Review
         8 (1913): 68-87: 81.
Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon,
            1977: 194; 1977, 171.
